Articles.Content:
I didn't realize it until this station module was well on its way to the Mun. 

Depending on whether you support the Axis or the Allies, this might be an MP40 or M3 submachine gun. Certainly did not expect that result in KSP at all. 

![s1I8leZ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/s1I8leZ.jpg)

-Snip-

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-17T07:56:07Z" title="08/17/2015 07:56  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 17, 2015</time> by Levelord**
  
Dropbox links got flooded

> 
> [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot1.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot1.png)
> [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot148.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot148.png)
> 
> [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot149.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot149.png)

That Spaceplane actually looks nice in my opinion.

My weirdest ship was 2 kethane mobile refinery & 2 mobile driller rovers that were being launched in one shot. It had a weird skycrane with the 4 rovers attached. Empty, the payload was easily over 100 tons but launch weight was 170 tons or so. I did get it to the Mun on a few different launches really close to where I was going to set down at only for RCS to stop working every time before touchdown.

Levelord... No idea why those ships are in this thread. They look great! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I shall submit this one here, because the other one is [not safe for work](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/44754370/screenshot35.png).

![screenshot6.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/44754370/screenshot6.png)

And then, well. This one was not technically a ship, but taken out of context it definitely fits the thread! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) (That poor launch clamp...)

![screenshot60.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/44754370/screenshot60.png)

Man this is a toughie. But I think my number one weirdest ship has to be the *Nobel*, a mission to deflect an asteroid using only the explosive force of decouplers.

[![14023095411_a79226e329_o.png](https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7349/14023095411_a79226e329_o.png)](https://flic.kr/p/nnb2H6)

It has four "bombs" originally but two had to be jettisoned en route to save weight. The remaining two nonetheless had enough explosive force to do the job.

Honourable mentions from my archives:

A rocket that flies backwards: [https://flic.kr/p/oPcP8s](https://flic.kr/p/oPcP8s)

What it takes to achieve 40 km/s with a 60 ton boat as the payload: [https://flic.kr/p/oGGiYs](https://flic.kr/p/oGGiYs)

How to test a Mammoth engine in flight on Kerbin: [https://flic.kr/p/s8uvFc](https://flic.kr/p/s8uvFc)

Looks normal, but know that the outer pair of boosters was attached using KAS when the rocket was already out on the launchpad: [https://flic.kr/p/rbNbpo](https://flic.kr/p/rbNbpo)

My weirdest \*plane\* ever: [https://flic.kr/p/qiW69v](https://flic.kr/p/qiW69v)

Holy Kraken, a rocket chainsaw: [https://flic.kr/p/pU1poQ](https://flic.kr/p/pU1poQ)

Building bridges: [https://flic.kr/p/pAeYdV](https://flic.kr/p/pAeYdV)

Probably my 2STO. An abandoned research into an SSTO attachment which would leave a fully fuelled spaceplane in orbit and return to base like a spaceplane. It started off pretty simple but the failed attempts would lead to increasingly degenerate solutions.

![2015-06-18_00012.jpg](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3152580/sshots/2015-06-18_00012.jpg)

And here's the spaceplane extricating itself from the ring of engines. No, bodywork doesn't come out unscratched. Some serious force is necessary.

![2015-06-18_00014.jpg](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3152580/sshots/2015-06-18_00014.jpg)

Some earlier attempts were arguably even more degenerate but the "turtleneck" was the first to make it to the orbit.

![2015-06-18_00002.jpg](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3152580/sshots/2015-06-18_00002.jpg)

Well, there's always X-BOW launch system too. 

![2015-06-14_00007.jpg](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/3152580/sshots/2015-06-14_00007.jpg)

Oh my word, this has to be the most amazing compendium of unusual craft. 

I like cantab's decoupler "torpedo boat" for the sheer number of little parts, those are rows upon rows of decouplers!!

 Streetwind's 'wrecking ball' is so hilarious and the figher looks a bit like The Last Starfighter. Those *interesting* spaceplanes and Sharpy's X-Bow launcher (Does it work!? I wanna see a video if you have one!)

And I do agree Levelord's space fighter like craft and starship looks pretty authentic and well made. Esp that circular section of solar panels (if those are solar panels)

My mind is boggled by this thread ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

You guys have so much more imagination than me!

my craft all tend to be a bit ordinary.

> 
> [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot1.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot1.png)
> [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot148.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot148.png)
> 
> [https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot149.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/16683090/KSP/screenshot149.png)

That's stunning!

First one is from way back .10-ish. Odd contraption thanks to Sunday Punch's Wobbly Rockets and Nova Silisko's SIDR pack

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4VGukRyjyk4?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Next is from some version from last year. A mobile miner/refinery inspired by Dune's Mobile Spice Harverster using an amalgam of a zillion mods.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ajBhr0P4Rxc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

It probably has to be this:

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/BMfaC)

About a year ago in 0.23:

**Damocles**

100% stock

100% useless

100% pain in the rear to launch

![screenshot14.2.png](http://tex.texel.com/ksp023/screenshot14.2.png)

The Lobster Delivery Frame is still probably the strangest thing I've flown.

![4bFs1Z6.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/4bFs1Z6.jpg)

![xC7j6sz.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/xC7j6sz.jpg)

Although, the upside-down Lincoln Memorial Lifter is right up there.

![KUWQlA1.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/KUWQlA1.jpg)

It was the headlander ... It is fully capable of landing on 'the other side':

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/D2GHG)

Testing a turbine to power boats. 

![ms1qrKV.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ms1qrKV.jpg)

I built this in 0.24. It was my first spaceplane to successfully carry a full orange tank to LKO.

![yiSjwhz.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/yiSjwhz.jpg)

Happy landings!

Probably one of these:

[![screen23.jpg](http://i39.servimg.com/u/f39/17/27/45/47/screen23.jpg)](http://www.servimg.com/view/17274547/128)

[![screen44.jpg](http://i58.servimg.com/u/f58/17/27/45/47/screen44.jpg)](http://www.servimg.com/view/17274547/75)

[![screen61.jpg](http://i58.servimg.com/u/f58/17/27/45/47/screen61.jpg)](http://www.servimg.com/view/17274547/96)

[![screen58.jpg](http://i58.servimg.com/u/f58/17/27/45/47/screen58.jpg)](http://www.servimg.com/view/17274547/91)

[![screen25.jpg](http://i39.servimg.com/u/f39/17/27/45/47/screen25.jpg)](http://www.servimg.com/view/17274547/130)

[![clipbo11.jpg](http://i58.servimg.com/u/f58/17/27/45/47/clipbo11.jpg)](http://www.servimg.com/view/17274547/95)

Hmm, there's more weird ones than I'd thought xP

> 
> [http://i39.servimg.com/u/f39/17/27/45/47/screen25.jpg](http://i39.servimg.com/u/f39/17/27/45/47/screen25.jpg)

Whoa, how did you build it? Whole VAB would fit inside that thing!

(and what are these orange thingies?)

Orbital disco ball!

![screenshot725.png](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-D_JWKQ6O5vo/VLxy57hGUJI/AAAAAAAABTI/rGsNeta0c34/s640-Ic42/screenshot725.png)

This will probably be one of the tamest ships on this thread, but I still can't get over how funky this Spaceplane has gotten as I keep tweaking it week after week. All of this to just tow a non-SSTO spaceplane into orbit.

![fBaJzBUd.jpg](http://i.imgbox.com/fBaJzBUd.jpg)

I didn't have any video recording software at the time I built it, but I do have now and the "craft" is still there...

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tCdePYGNaoE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Lol! Food themed craft are the best. Here, have a [burger rover](http://imgur.com/a/WeXSx). It never really caught on as an orbital restaurant for obvious reasons ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

OMG so cute. Btw I have started to use pink, green and cyan for my 'orientation lights'. I tried the full rainbow but that killed the framerates lol.
